modules.summary: Working in teams is an essential part of today’s modern workplace. An increasing number of workers are remote, mobile, or work from different time zones and geographic locations. In this module, you'll learn about the Microsoft 365 tools that facilitate teamwork for all workers, no matter where they're located or how they connect to your organization’s resources. These tools include apps designed for co-authoring and file sharing, security and compliance controls, and access controls via Azure Active Directory.
modules.title: Introduction to teamwork in Microsoft 365

modules.summary: Every team is unique, but there is one experience they all demand—the ability to communicate, collaborate, and share securely, whenever and wherever work happens. Microsoft Teams and Office 365 applications help provide the collaborative experiences that employees want, including the ability to be flexible, mobile, and productive on the devices of their choice.
modules.title: Facilitate teamwork to achieve more with Microsoft 365

modules.summary: Today, work is more collaborative, diverse, and global than ever before. How do you bring together different types of teams, with diverse team members from all over the world, and enable them to work together effectively? You bring them Microsoft Teams, the innovative solution for modern communication and collaboration needs.
modules.title: Enable modern communication and collaboration with Microsoft Teams

modules.summary: Learn about the different Microsoft solutions for managing security in your organization. Microsoft 365 provides a holistic approach to security, helping you to protect identities, data, applications, and devices across on-premises, cloud, and mobile.
modules.title: Introduction to security in Microsoft 365

modules.summary: Learn how Microsoft 365 helps you meet your compliance needs. Microsoft 365 complies with global, industry, and regional standards and regulations and is designed to help you to meet the regulatory requirements for your business. You will learn what integrated compliance solutions are available within Microsoft 365 and how they can help your organization leverage intelligence to reduce your compliance risk.
modules.title: Introduction to compliance tools in Microsoft 365

modules.summary: Today’s organizations must meet growing demands for transparency, privacy, and compliance. Both customers and employees need to trust that their personal information and data are protected and secure. Microsoft 365 has integrated, intelligent compliance solutions to help organizations reduce risks.
modules.title: Meet the growing demand for transparency, privacy, and compliance with Microsoft 365

modules.summary: Microsoft identity platform is an evolution of the Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) developer platform. It allows developers to build applications that sign in users, and access resources in both external applications such as Microsoft Office 365, the Azure portal, and thousands of other SaaS applications as well as internal resources, such as apps on your corporate network and intranet, along with any cloud apps developed by your own organization. In this module, you will learn the basics of Microsoft identity including the different types of tokens, account types, and supported topologies.
modules.title: Getting Started with Microsoft Identity

modules.summary: The Microsoft Identity platform enables developers to build many different types of applications to satisfy diverse business requirements and different scenarios. By supporting multiple OAuth 2.0 standard authentication protocols, developers can create different types of applications that meet business needs including single page applications, web apps, mobile or native apps, and services or daemon apps. In this module, you’ll learn how you can implement different OAuth 2.0 protocol grant types (flows) in popular application types.
modules.title: Application types in Microsoft identity

modules.summary: The Microsoft identity platform implements the OAuth 2.0 authorization protocol. This protocol is a method that a third-party app can access web-hosted resources on behalf of a user. The web-hosted resources can define a set of permissions that you can use to implement functionality in smaller chunks. Developers can leverage one of two types of permissions supported by the Microsoft identity platform depending on the app scenario. In this module, you'll learn the different types of permissions and consent framework models for obtaining permissions from users to use them in apps.
modules.title: Permissions and Consent Framework

modules.summary: Many solutions involve creating web APIs to expose functionality to different clients and consumers. Developers can secure these APIs using Microsoft identity to ensure only approved apps can access the web APIs provided they've been granted the necessary permissions. In this module, you’ll learn how to secure a web API with Microsoft identity and how to call it from another application.
modules.title: Secure custom APIs with Microsoft Identity

modules.summary: Role-based access control (RBAC) is a popular mechanism to enforce authorization in applications. The administrator assigns roles to different users and groups to control who can access to what content and functionality. Using RBAC with Application Roles and Role Claims, developers can securely enforce authorization in their apps with little effort on their part. Another approach is to use Azure AD Groups and Group Claims. In this module, you’ll learn how to use both Azure AD Groups and Application Roles to provide fine grained access control to an application.
modules.title: Work with users, groups, and roles in custom apps and APIs

modules.summary: The Office Add-ins platform enables you to extend the functionality of Office applications. In this module, you'll explore various ways you can use add-ins to extend and interact with Office applications. You'll also learn about configuring your add-in using the add-in's manifest file.
modules.title: Understand Office Add-ins fundamentals

modules.summary: In this module, you'll learn about the Office Add-ins programming model, developer tools, and the capabilities of the Office JavaScript APIs for Excel, Outlook, and Word.
modules.title: Understand Office Javascript APIs

modules.summary: The Office Add-ins platform enables you to customize your add-in. In this module, you'll explore how to customize your add-in by persisting state, and using Office UI Fabric and Microsoft Graph.
modules.title: Understand how to customize Office Add-ins

modules.summary: In this module, you'll explore testing, debugging, and deployment options for Office Add-ins.
modules.title: Understand testing, debugging, and deployment options for Office Add-ins

modules.summary: Learn about Windows Virtual Desktop.
modules.title: Introduction to Windows Virtual Desktop in Microsoft Azure

modules.summary: Learn how to prepare for Windows Virtual Desktop - a cloud-based virtualization solution running on Microsoft Azure. Windows Virtual Desktop is an elastically scalable service to deliver remote desktop and remote app experiences - without having to manage the underlying server infrastructure. Review the prerequisites and tools provided by Microsoft to get ready to provision your first Windows Virtual Desktop host pool.
modules.title: Prepare for Windows Virtual Desktop in Microsoft Azure

modules.summary: Learn how to deploy Windows Virtual Desktop, including the wizard-based process to provision a Windows Virtual Desktop host pool and how to customize remote desktops and RemoteApps for your users.
modules.title: Deploy Windows Virtual Desktop in Microsoft Azure

modules.summary: Learn the steps to optimize Windows Virtual Desktop, including how to customize a basic environment to take advantage of new storage, file management, and automated scaling options.
modules.title: Optimize Windows Virtual Desktop in Microsoft Azure

modules.summary: Microsoft Teams is an extensible platform you can build custom apps on. Understand what is possible with a Microsoft Teams custom app, and determine if it is right for you.
modules.title: Introduction to building apps for Microsoft Teams

modules.summary: In this module, you’ll learn how to create different types of messaging extensions in a custom Microsoft Teams app.
modules.title: Task-oriented interactions in Microsoft Teams with messaging extensions

modules.summary: Tabs are Microsoft Teams-aware webpages embedded in Microsoft Teams. They can be added as part of a channel or a group chat inside a team or as a personal app for an individual user. As part of your app, you can add custom tabs to embed your own web content in Teams. Two types of tabs are available in Teams, channel/group and personal. In this module, you'll learn how to create tabs and add them to your Microsoft Teams app.
modules.title: Create embedded web experiences with tabs for Microsoft Teams

modules.summary: Conversational bots allow users to interact with your web service through text, interactive cards, and task modules. Conversational bots can be scoped to handling a few simple commands or complex, artificial intelligence powered and natural language processing virtual assistants. They can be one aspect of a larger application, or completely stand alone. In this module, you’ll learn how to create and add bots to custom Microsoft Teams apps.
modules.title: Create interactive conversational bots for Microsoft Teams

modules.summary: Task modules are modals that you can populate with either an Adaptive Card or an embedded web/content page for use in your custom Microsoft Teams app’s user experience for workflows that require data input. Task modules allow you to gather information in a Teams-aware popup. In this module, you'll learn how to create and add task modules to your Microsoft Teams app.
modules.title: Collect Input in Microsoft Teams with Task Modules

modules.summary: Webhooks and connectors are a simple way to connect your web services to channels and teams inside Microsoft Teams. Outgoing webhooks allow your users to send text messages from a channel to your web services. Connectors allow users to subscribe to receive notifications and messages from your web services. There are two types of connectors available in Microsoft Teams: incoming webhooks and Office 365 connectors. In this module, you’ll learn about webhooks and connectors and how to implement them in Microsoft Teams channels.
modules.title: Connect web services to Microsoft Teams with webhooks and Office 365 Connectors

modules.summary: Discover how SharePoint works with Microsoft 365. Learn the role and key tasks of the SharePoint administrator and the tools available to secure your environment.
modules.title: Plan for SharePoint in Microsoft 365

modules.summary: Discover how to plan your SharePoint sites to optimize sharing and collaborating. Learn about the different types of sites and how to set them up.
modules.title: Understand your SharePoint site options

modules.summary: Discover how sharing files and folders works in SharePoint. Learn how to share files externally.
modules.title: Collaborate with files and folders in SharePoint

modules.summary: Discover how to manage SharePoint sites in the SharePoint admin center. Learn about sharing and permissions, site usage, reporting and monitoring, and information protection.
modules.title: Manage your SharePoint sites

modules.summary: Microsoft Graph provides a unified programmability model that you can use to build apps for organizations and consumers that interact with the data of millions of users. The Microsoft Graph REST APIs implements many of the OData protocol’s query parameters. In this module, you will learn how to manipulate queries using query parameters.
modules.title: Optimize data usage when using Microsoft Graph with query parameters

modules.summary: Microsoft Graph provides a unified programmability model that you can use to build apps for organizations and consumers that interact with the data of millions of users. In this module, students will learn how Microsoft has implemented throttling to Microsoft Graph to limit the overuse of Microsoft Graph resources. Students will learn how to avoid requests from being throttled, as well as how to properly handle scenarios when Microsoft Graph throttles high user traffic in a graceful way.
modules.title: Optimize network traffic with Microsoft Graph

modules.summary: Users are the core of most operations in Microsoft 365. Microsoft Graph enables developers full control over the lifecycle of users in Microsoft 365 including creating, updating, and deleting users in addition to listing users in the organization. In this module, you’ll learn how to use Microsoft Graph to work with users in Microsoft 365 including the required permissions.
modules.title: Access User Data from Microsoft Graph

modules.summary: Groups are collections of users who share access to resources in Microsoft services or in your apps. Developers can use Microsoft Graph to create and manage different types of groups. In this module, you’ll learn how to manage the lifecycle of groups, the different types of groups and obtain information about the users associated with a group using Microsoft Graph.
modules.title: Manage Group Lifecycle with Microsoft Graph

modules.summary: OneDrive is the files hub for Office 365. OneDrive enables users to access and collaborate on files no matter where they're stored. Microsoft Graph enables developers to use a single API to work with the files in OneDrive. Files in Office 365 are stored in drives. Users can store files in a personal drive, their OneDrive, or in a shared drive powered by a SharePoint document library. In this module, you’ll learn how to access files in OneDrive, both reading and writing files, and how to traverse relationships between files and users.
modules.title: Access Files with Microsoft Graph

modules.summary: Microsoft Graph enables developers to consume user information stored in Microsoft 365 in custom applications. Data is retrieved from Microsoft Graph through a REST API or using one of the various native SDKs provided by Microsoft. In this module, you'll learn how to work with the Microsoft Graph .NET SDK to create an ASP.NET MVC web application to access data in Microsoft 365.
modules.title: Build ASP.NET MVC web applications with the Microsoft Graph .NET SDK

modules.summary: Microsoft Graph enables developers to consume user information stored in Microsoft 365 in custom applications. Data is retrieved from Microsoft Graph through a REST API or using one of the various native SDKs provided by Microsoft. In this module, you'll learn how to work with change notifications (webhooks) & track changes (delta query) in the Microsoft Graph.
modules.title: Use Change Notifications and Track Changes with Microsoft Graph

modules.summary: Learn about information protection and how Microsoft technologies can help protect your sensitive data.
modules.title: Information protection overview

modules.summary: Learn how Microsoft Information Protection helps your organization meet standards and requirements through supporting classification methods for end users.
modules.title: Information protection and the growing digital estate

modules.summary: Learn how to use information protection sensitivity labels to classify and protect your organizational data.
modules.title: Protect your data with sensitivity labels

modules.summary: Learn how information protection helps organizations protect data to prevent data loss or theft.
modules.title: Prevent data loss

modules.summary: Learn how to use information protection analytics and reporting to maximize data governance and protection.
modules.title: Monitor and analyze sensitive data

modules.summary: Throughout this module, you will learn about the key concepts and benefits of modern management with Microsoft 365. We will explore the four key pillars to modern management, and how they can help your organization manage all their devices in a modern way that is easy to deploy, up-to-date, secure and intelligent.
modules.title: Introduction to modern management in Microsoft 365

modules.summary: During the course of this module, you will learn about Windows Autopilot and the benefits it can provide to modern IT organizations. From the very beginning, to the very end of a device's lifecycle; Windows Autopilot is an essential tool to reduce the burden on IT teams when registering, resetting, and recovering devices.
modules.title: Automate Windows deployments by using Windows Autopilot

modules.summary: This module will introduce you to the modern device management options for Windows 10 from Microsoft 365, including co-management, Microsoft Intune, and Mobile Device Management (MDM) for Office 365.
modules.title: Manage devices by using Microsoft Intune

modules.summary: Co-management is one of the primary ways to attach your existing Configuration Manager deployment to the Microsoft 365 cloud. It helps you unlock additional cloud-powered capabilities like conditional access.
modules.title: Manage Windows 10 through co-management by using System Center Configuration Manager

modules.summary: Managing applications on devices in your organization is key to a secure and productive application ecosystem. Microsoft Intune is a cloud-based service that helps enable your workforce to be productive anywhere and, on any device; while keeping your corporate data protected. In this module, we will learn about considerations for implementing Mobile Application Management (MAM) and manage MAM policies in Intune.
modules.title: Manage applications by using Microsoft Intune

modules.summary: To keep computers that run Windows 10 stable and protected, you must update them regularly with the latest features, security updates, and fixes. To utilize Windows Update effectively, you must be aware of the configuration options that Windows Update has available, and you must guide users on how to configure these options.
modules.title: Deploy Windows Update in Microsoft 365

modules.summary: This module will introduce you to the SharePoint Framework and walk you through getting your local & online environment configured for developing with the SharePoint Framework.
modules.title: Get started with the SharePoint Framework

modules.summary: This module will introduce you to creating client-side web parts using the SharePoint Framework. You'll also see how to leverage both the local and hosted SharePoint Workbench & using different parts of the SharePoint Framework API.
modules.title: Develop web parts with the SharePoint Framework

modules.summary: This module will introduce you to leveraging the property pane for client-side web parts created with the SharePoint Framework.
modules.title: Enable SharePoint Framework web part configuration with property panes

modules.summary: This module will introduce you to working with SharePoint content in SharePoint Framework projects. You'll learn about the SharePoint REST API, do CRUD operations with SharePoint data, the local workbench and creating mock data in SharePoint Framework.
modules.title: Work with SharePoint Content using the SharePoint Framework

modules.summary: This module will introduce you to extending the SharePoint user interface with extensions.
modules.title: Extend the SharePoint user interface with SharePoint Framework extensions

modules.summary: This module introduces you to using external APIs in your SharePoint Framework projects. SharePoint Framework projects can incorporate data from anonymous APIs, those REST APIs secured with Azure AD, and Microsoft Graph.
modules.title: Leverage Microsoft Graph & third-party APIs

modules.summary: This module will address the topic of deploying your SharePoint Framework customizations to production environments.
modules.title: Deploy SharePoint Framework Components to Production

modules.summary: This module will introduce you to leveraging your SharePoint Framework customizations in Microsoft Teams.
modules.title: Build Microsoft Teams customization using the SharePoint Framework

modules.summary: Learn the basic steps and considerations when you manage Office upgrades in a large-scale environment.
modules.title: Introduction to upgrading Office at scale

modules.summary: Learn the steps to prepare for Office upgrades in Windows at scale, including the prerequisites and tools provided by Microsoft to help you get ready for Office upgrades and for long-term management.
modules.title: Prepare to upgrade and update Office at scale in Windows

modules.summary: Learn how to perform Office upgrades in Windows at scale, including the tools to help you create, configure, and deploy Office packages.
modules.title: Upgrading Office in Windows

modules.summary: Learn how to manage and troubleshoot common issues with Office in Windows.
modules.title: Manage and troubleshoot common issues with Office in Windows

modules.summary: Review the Microsoft Teams user experience and learn about requirements and important considerations for deploying Teams as part of a Microsoft 365 installation. You’ll also learn about governance policies, such as expiration, retention, and archiving.
modules.title: Prepare for a Teams deployment with Microsoft 365

modules.summary: Learn about the various Microsoft Teams clients, including desktop, web, and mobile clients. Discover how to deploy each type of client and how the update process works.
modules.title: Deploy Microsoft Teams clients

modules.summary: Microsoft Teams gives administrators and IT professionals the tools they need to effectively manage team communication, collaboration, and compliance while taking advantage of the rich apps and features offered by Microsoft 365. Learn how to create teams and manage their members by determining roles, access, and messaging policies for both internal and external users.
modules.title: Manage Microsoft Teams

modules.summary: Discover how apps, bots, and connectors increase the power of Microsoft Teams. Learn how to manage them as you plan your organization’s Teams rollout.
modules.title: Manage apps, bots, and connectors in Microsoft Teams

modules.summary: Learn how to plan and manage Microsoft Teams meetings and conferences. Discover how audio conferencing and live events work in Teams.
modules.title: Manage meetings, conferences, and events with Microsoft Teams

modules.summary: Learn about how attackers most commonly breach organizations--and the Microsoft tools that protect your organization in an ever shifting landscape.
modules.title: Introduction to threat protection with Microsoft 365

modules.summary: Learn how new threat protection tools from Microsoft protect your organization’s users, devices, and data from attempted attacks.
modules.title: Protect against threats with Microsoft Defender Advanced Threat Protection

modules.summary: Learn how to apply security strategy principles to your organization’s cybersecurity framework to detect and respond to threats.
modules.title: Apply Microsoft security strategy principles

modules.summary: Learn about the Microsoft service adoption framework and the Service Adoption Specialist role.
modules.title: Introduction to the Microsoft service adoption framework

modules.summary: In the first phase of the service adoption framework, Start, you gather organizational objectives and build out your strategy and deployment plan.
modules.title: Service adoption framework - Phase 1, Start

modules.summary: Learn about the second phase of the service adoption framework, Experiment.
modules.title: Service adoption framework - Phase 2, Experiment

modules.summary: Learn about the third phase of the service adoption framework, Scale.
modules.title: Service adoption framework - Phase 3, Scale

modules.summary: Microsoft 365 Enterprise includes Office 365, Windows 10 Enterprise, and Enterprise Mobility and Security - representing a complete, intelligent solution to empower everyone in your organization to collaborate and be creative, securely. Learn what Microsoft 365 is and how the software-as-a-service cloud model helps your organization.
modules.title: What is Microsoft 365?

modules.summary: Your Microsoft 365 subscription includes Office 365, Windows 10 Enterprise, and Enterprise Mobility + Security. You may already be using on-premises versions of many of these servers (like Exchange Server). Let’s take a closer look at the cloud services and see how they differ from the on-prem versions you're already familiar with.
modules.title: Introduction to Microsoft 365 core services and features

modules.summary: A modern desktop is secure, productive, and efficient. Explore the benefits of modern desktop and how to make the shift to Windows 10 and Office 365 ProPlus.
modules.title: Move to a modern desktop with Microsoft 365

modules.summary: Unified endpoint management helps users be productive wherever they are while keeping corporate information secure. Learn about Microsoft 365's flexible management and security solutions that let you deliver protected mobile experiences on any device.
modules.title: Introduction to Microsoft 365 unified endpoint management

modules.summary: Explore some basic concepts and tasks that are involved with managing your Microsoft 365 subscription including subscription billing, licensing users, and how to get assistance in Microsoft 365.
modules.title: Manage your Microsoft 365 subscription

modules.summary: Learn how companies can work purely in the cloud (“cloud-only”) or connect existing on-premises systems to the cloud to extend the value of their legacy infrastructure (“hybrid”). You’ll see how these two different service models require different approaches to migration, and then you’ll review a few scenarios that demonstrate when to choose one type of migration over the other. Finally, we’ll review some considerations for how an organization approaches migrating systems with older versions of Office, Windows, and Office Server to Microsoft 365.
modules.title: Select a cloud deployment model

modules.summary: Discover the upgrade process from Skype for Business to Microsoft Teams. Learn how Skype for Business and Microsoft Teams coexist during the upgrade process and what hybrid connectivity is.
modules.title: Getting started with your Teams upgrade

modules.summary: Discover how to prepare your organization to upgrade from Skype for Business to Microsoft Teams. Learn how to assess your environment, prepare your environment and organization, and how to conduct a user pilot.
modules.title: Plan your Teams upgrade

modules.summary: Discover how coexistence works when upgrading from Skype for Business to Microsoft Teams. Learn what the coexistence modes are, how interoperability works, and how to manage coexistence.
modules.title: Understand coexistence and interoperability

modules.summary: Learn about the upgrade process from Skype for Business to Microsoft Teams and how to upgrade to Teams from both Skype for Business Online and Skype for Business on-premises.
modules.title: Upgrade to Teams from Skype for Business

modules.summary: Learn how to facilitate moving an on-premises Skype environment to the cloud by setting up hybrid connectivity. Discover how to configure connectivity, move users between on-premises and cloud, and disable hybrid connectivity once you’ve completed the migration.
modules.title: Understand hybrid connectivity

modules.summary: Learn how identity and access management work in Microsoft 365.
modules.title: Overview of identity and access management in Microsoft 365

modules.summary: Learn how to use Microsoft 365 authentication tools for access and identity provisioning.
modules.title: Simplify access and identity provisioning with Microsoft 365

modules.summary: Learn how to strengthen authentication across your enterprise deployment with security tools from Microsoft 365.
modules.title: Strengthen authentication with Microsoft 365

modules.summary: Learn how to protect the most important credentials in your enterprise ecosystem - administrator credentials.
modules.title: Protect those most targeted

modules.summary: Learn how to promote an enterprise-wide security mindset with Microsoft 365.
modules.title: Use Microsoft 365 to promote a security mindset

modules.summary: Learn how the security management tools from Microsoft help you protect your organization’s users, devices, and data.
modules.title: Overview of security management in Microsoft 365 security center

modules.summary: Learn how to take advantage of the reporting and insights available through the Microsoft 365 security center to drive organizational security health.
modules.title: Use reporting in the Microsoft 365 security center

modules.summary: Learn how Office 365 Advanced Threat Protection (ATP) helps safeguard your organization against unknown malware, viruses, and harmful email links and attachments.
modules.title: Protect mail with Office 365 Advanced Threat Protection

modules.summary: Learn how to mitigate end-point threats by using Windows 10 security features.
modules.title: Secure Windows 10 endpoints

modules.summary: A modern workplace provides the collaborative, intelligent, and secure experiences required by today’s fast-paced organizations concerned with recruiting the best talent and staying ahead of security threats, Microsoft can help you solve your business challenges.
modules.title: Discover modern workplace solutions with Microsoft 365 and Surface for Business

modules.summary: To boost productivity, teamwork, and creativity, your workforce needs software that saves time; but the devices they work on are equally as important. Surface for Business devices are designed to work best with Microsoft 365.
modules.title: Discover how your organization can achieve more with Surface for Business and Microsoft 365

modules.summary: Organizations today have the opportunity, and the need, to balance the technology needs of users and IT. Users want to get the job done on whatever device they choose. Meanwhile, IT teams need tools to deploy and manage PCs that are efficient, agile, secure, and compliant. Windows 10 and Office 365 ProPlus offer the solutions to do both.
modules.title: Balance IT and user needs with Windows 10 and Office 365 ProPlus

modules.summary: Cybersecurity threats are everywhere. There is an opportunity to leverage the power of the cloud to better secure your modern workplace without sacrificing productivity. Microsoft 365 helps organizations address that challenge with built-in, intelligent security.
modules.title: Secure your organization with built-in, intelligent security from Microsoft 365

modules.summary: In this module, we will go through a series of customer conversations for moving to a cloud-based modern workplace with Microsoft 365 and Surface for Business.
modules.title: Deliver the value of modern workplace through business conversations

modules.summary: The journey to a modern workplace requires change—and that change must be managed for the best possible results. With each new deployment, an organization not only needs to get software deployed, it needs to get users up and running fast, and encourage them to embrace the change. When an organization is ready for Microsoft 365, Microsoft has resources and services available—at no additional cost—to help accelerate those deployments and improve adoption of the solutions.
modules.title: Accelerate deployment and improve adoption of Microsoft 365 with FastTrack

modules.summary: Discover best practices for ensuring a smooth transition to Windows 10 and Office 365 ProPlus by using the eight-step deployment process.
modules.title: Get started with Microsoft 365

modules.summary: Learn about the four-step process for analyzing device and application readiness and the tools provided by Microsoft to help you get ready, from the Windows Analytics Upgrade Readiness tool to the Readiness Toolkit for Office.
modules.title: Analyze your device and app readiness for Windows 10

modules.summary: When it comes to preparing your network for a deployment, you need to take into consideration any and all components that have an impact on bandwidth. In this module, we’ll explore the tools and options for preparing your directory services and network for deployment to Windows 10 and Office 365 ProPlus.
modules.title: Analyze your directory and network readiness for Microsoft 365

modules.summary: Learn how Click-to-Run packaging with Office 365 ProPlus provides new options to configure, deliver, and keep your Office apps up-to-date. Ensure your third-party and business apps are packaged and ready for automated installation.
modules.title: Deliver Office 365 ProPlus and business apps

modules.summary: When refreshing or replacing PCs, it is important to give users a like-for-like experience on their new device to minimize productivity downtime. Whether using a manual or automated process, learn about the different options for ensuring users’ files and settings have been captured and migrated.
modules.title: Migrate user files and settings in Microsoft 365

modules.summary: Learn about changes to Windows 10 and Office 365 ProPlus that help you protect your data, devices, and users while quickly detecting and responding to threats. Learn about anti-malware app compatibility, policies when moving to Windows 10, and how to deal with common problems associated with disk encryption.
modules.title: Update your security and compliance configuration – Windows 10 and Office 365 ProPlus

modules.summary: Learn how to take advantage of familiar options, such as task sequence-based deployment, or modern options such as Windows Autopilot to help automate large scale, phased deployment for bare metal installs, PC refresh, and PC replacement. Additionally, understand how upgrading task sequences can help organizations stay current with major semi-annual updates.
modules.title: Deploy, upgrade, and migrate to Windows 10

modules.summary: Both Windows 10 and Office 365 ProPlus continually add new capabilities to keep bringing user experiences and security forward with the latest innovations. Learn how to stay current with semi-annual and monthly updates, how the new servicing model works, and what tools and options are available.
modules.title: Learn about Windows and Office 365 ProPlus servicing in Microsoft 365

modules.summary: To ensure your workforce remains productive and secure, they need to be informed about new experiences, features, and functionalities within Windows 10 and Office 365 ProPlus.
modules.title: Train users on the new Windows and Office 365 ProPlus features

modules.summary: Learn how to use audio elements to make an inclusive Windows app. Configure your app to work well with Narrator, and add a custom speech recognition system for spoken input.
modules.title: Configure your Windows app to use Narrator and speech recognition

modules.summary: Use Azure AD B2C as the full-featured identity system for your application, and ensure users are required to sign in securely through multi-factor authentication.
modules.title: Enable secure external user access for your applications with Azure AD B2C

modules.summary: Organizations big and small have started to realize just how crucial system and application reliability is to their business. They’ve also learned just how difficult it is to maintain that reliability while iterating at the speed demanded by the marketplace. Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is a proven approach to this challenge.
modules.title: Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)

modules.summary: Learn how to create an Azure IoT Central application to monitor and manage an IoT device.
modules.title: Monitor and manage your coffee machine with Azure IoT Central

modules.summary: Learn about the relation between UI and data in Windows 10 apps, and implement data binding in your applications.
modules.title: Implement data binding in your Windows 10 application

modules.summary: Create a simple load test via the Azure portal, run it and check the results, and then customize the test in Azure DevOps.
modules.title: Load test Azure web apps by using Azure DevOps

modules.summary: Securely authenticate applications to Azure to manage and access Azure services. Service principals and managed identities for Azure resources give your app an Azure Active Directory identity.
modules.title: Authenticate apps to Azure services by using service principals and managed identities for Azure resources

modules.summary: Learn about digital identities and how they can be managed and synchronized within an organization.
modules.title: Secure your cloud resources with access control

modules.summary: Grant access to data stored in your Azure Storage accounts securely through the use of shared access signatures.
modules.title: Control access to Azure Storage with shared access signatures

modules.title: Fundamentals of network security

modules.summary: Application Insights is an Azure service that you can use to monitor the behavior and performance of a web application. If you run a web app in Azure, you can take advantage of several benefits provided by Application Insights simply by enabling it, without changing any of your code. When you complete this module, you'll know how to enable Application Insights and client-side monitoring and view metrics in the portal.
modules.title: Capture and view page load times in your Azure web app with Application Insights

modules.summary:
Learn how to enable the Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL), install your favorite Linux distribution, set up an integrated dev environment with Visual Studio Code, and more.

The time it takes to complete this course could vary because you will need to install multiple tools.
modules.title: Get started with the Windows Subsystem for Linux

modules.summary: Learn how to add navigation and media to the UI of your Windows 10 app to enhance the user experience.
modules.title: Enhance the user interface of your Windows 10 app

modules.summary: Learn about the cloud, including the history, building blocks, and types on your way to becoming a Cloud Administrator.
modules.title: Foundations of cloud computing for administrators

modules.summary: What do you do when something goes wrong with your resources on the cloud? How do you prepare for such an issue? Learn about disaster backup and recovery with this module.
modules.title: Cloud security

modules.summary: Use Bash to manage IT infrastructure.
modules.title: Introduction to Bash

modules.summary: Combine multiple Azure Functions apps into a unified interface by importing them into a single Azure API Management instance.
modules.title: Expose multiple Azure Function apps as a consistent API by using Azure API Management

modules.summary: Use application logging and retry policies to handle transient errors to make your apps more resilient.
modules.title: Handle transient errors in your app

modules.summary: Azure Batch is a Platform as a Service (PaaS) provided by Microsoft to run large-scale parallel, high performant, computing applications in Azure. In this module you'll write a .NET Core console app to perform video transcoding, in parallel, with Azure Batch services.
modules.title: Create an app to run parallel compute jobs in Azure Batch

modules.summary: Create a web app in IntelliJ and deploy the app to Azure by using Azure Toolkit for IntelliJ.
modules.title: Publish a web app to Azure by using Azure Toolkit for IntelliJ

modules.summary: Learn about and adopt Azure Lighthouse for your managed service business to manage your customers at scale.
modules.title: Use Azure Lighthouse with your managed business service

modules.summary: Compare the types of properties and metadata associated with Azure storage blobs, and examine the methods used to view and modify these values. Add code to ASP.NET Core apps to retrieve and modify metadata.
modules.title: Organize Azure storage blobs with properties and metadata

modules.summary: ASP.NET Core supports creating webpages using a built-in templating engine called Razor. In this module, you'll learn how to create webpages using Razor with ASP.NET Core.

modules.summary: Inclusive app design provides support for users with visual or motor skills impairment. This module will show you how to support such users in a Windows app.

modules.summary: You learned how to publish static web content using an Azure Content Delivery Network (CDN) and Azure Blob Services.

modules.summary: Use Redis caching in Azure to reduce the load on databases. Apply different caching architectures to support larger loads in distributed and high-volume environments.
modules.title: Optimize your web applications by caching read-only data with Redis

modules.title: Enable secure external collaboration for your applications with Azure AD B2B

modules.summary: Use the advanced detection and remediation of identity-based threats to protect your Azure AD identities and applications from compromise
modules.title: Protect your identities with Azure AD Identity Protection

learningPaths.summary:
Are you interested in learning about the cloud in an easy to understand way? Or perhaps you are confused about where to begin with cloud technology? This learning experience will take you on a journey that will begin by showing you how digital transformation and the power of the cloud can transform your business. We will cover how Microsoft Azure cloud services can power your organization on a trusted cloud platform. Finally, we will wrap up by illustrating how to make this journey real for your organization. In this learning path, you will learn about:

  • Enabling digital transformation.
  • Identifying ways to migrate and modernize applications.
  • Gaining insights through data, artificial intelligence (AI) and the Internet of Things (IoT)
  • Meeting a broad set of regulatory and compliance standards on a trusted cloud platform.

learningPaths.summary:
Learn more about how the cloud works by exploring it's underlying technology of virtualization, how to take advantage of the cloud for scale, and how to automate cloud resource management.

In this learning path, you will:

  • Learn about virtualization and how it's used in the cloud
  • Know what VMs and containers are
  • Understand what scale, load, and common load patterns are
  • Know what autoscaling is and be familiar with autoscaling techniques
  • Learn how to automate cloud resource management with scripts
  • Understand the concept of infrastructure-as-code

In Partnership with Dr. Majd Sakr and Carnegie Mellon University.
