learningPaths.summary: In government, decision-makers must take into account specific public sector considerations before they can realize the true transformational power of AI. It's critical to understand the components of a strategy that will help the public sector create value with AI. This learning path is designed for government decision-makers to illustrate the true transformational impact of AI in the public sector.
learningPaths.title: AI business school for government

learningPaths.summary: As an IT Professional experienced in SAP solutions, you need to understand how to leverage Azure resources that include virtual machines, virtual networks, storage accounts, and Azure AD. These modules will provide the basis for running SAP workloads in Azure.
learningPaths.title: SAP certified offerings for Azure

learningPaths.summary: In this learning path, you will hear from Peter Zemsky, INSEAD's Eli Lilly Chaired Professor of Strategy and Innovation, about how AI is driving business value across industries and companies as well as Microsoft customers and partners. You will be able to discuss how technical teams are brining AI into business applications and how business leaders of different industries are thinking about AI for their own businesses.
learningPaths.title: Define an AI strategy to create business value

learningPaths.summary: NoSQL data is an efficient way to store information that doesn’t map to the requirements of a relational SQL database. Learn how to use the Azure portal, the Azure Cosmos DB extension for Visual Studio Code, and the Azure Cosmos DB .NET Core SDK to work with your NoSQL data where you want, and provide your users with high availability, no matter where they are in the world.
learningPaths.title: Work with NoSQL data in Azure Cosmos DB

learningPaths.summary: Decision-makers in financial services have considerations that are particular to their industry to help them realize the true transformational impact of AI in the enterprise. It is critical to understand the components of a strategy that will help the financial services sector create business value with AI.
learningPaths.title: AI business school for financial services

learningPaths.summary: Azure was designed for security and compliance. Learn how to leverage the built-in services to store your app data securely to ensure that only authorized services and clients have access to it.
learningPaths.title: Secure your cloud data

learningPaths.summary: Learn how to protect and harden your virtual machines in Azure
learningPaths.title: Implement virtual machine host security in Azure

learningPaths.summary: SQL Server now runs on your choice of operating system. In this learning path you will discover the fundamentals of SQL Server on Linux, before discovering how to run SQL Server on Linux containers and deploy SQL Server on Linux. You will then learn how to automatically tune your SQL Server on Linux deployment.
learningPaths.title: SQL Server on Linux

learningPaths.summary: In this learning path, you will see how Azure Data Lake Storage can make processing Big Data analytical solutions more efficient and how easy it is to set up. You will also explore how it fits into common architectures, as well as the different methods of uploading the data to the data store. You will finally examine the myriad of security features that will ensure your data is secure.
learningPaths.title: Large-Scale Data Processing with Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2

learningPaths.summary: Learn how to architect a secure, flexible, network infrastructure in Azure and connect on-premises networks to your Azure resources.
learningPaths.title: Architect network infrastructure in Azure

learningPaths.summary: Dive deeper into data and types, learning how to manipulate string and numeric data.
learningPaths.title: Work with data in C#

learningPaths.summary: Do you want to improve the user's experience in your canvas app? Do you want to use custom connectors to connect to data? This learning path will help you do both things. It will also focus on working with data source limits.
learningPaths.title: Use advanced data options and connectors in Power Apps

learningPaths.summary: Do you want to make business decisions backed by data? Learn how to do that in Power BI. Learn to work in Power BI to review and interact with this content to make business decisions.
learningPaths.title: Consume data with Power BI

learningPaths.summary: Do you want to create button flows to solve business problems? Then, take this learning path, which introduces you to Power Automate buttons and demonstrates how to create button flows.
learningPaths.title: Get started with Power Automate buttons

learningPaths.summary: Do you want to make sure your app is the best it can be? This learning path will help you use advanced formulas and perform custom updates. It will also focus on performance checks and testing.
learningPaths.title: Master advanced techniques for Power Apps canvas apps

learningPaths.summary: This learning path introduces you to Power Automate, teaches you how to build workflows, and how to administer flows.
learningPaths.title: Automate a business process using Power Automate

learningPaths.summary: This learning path introduces you to creating business process flows in Power Automate.
learningPaths.title: This learning path introduces you to creating business process flows in Power Automate.

learningPaths.summary: This learning path introduces you to creating a model-driven app in Power Apps that uses Common Data Service.
learningPaths.title: Create a model-driven application in Power Apps

learningPaths.summary: Do you want to use formulas to improve functionality and change a behavior in your Power Apps canvas app? This learning path can help you accomplish your goal.
learningPaths.title: Use basic formulas to make better Power Apps canvas apps

learningPaths.summary: Learn the business value and product capabilities of Power Platform. Create a simple PowerApp, connect data with CDS, build a Power BI Dashboard, and automate a process with Microsoft Flow.
learningPaths.title: Microsoft Power Platform Fundamentals

learningPaths.summary: Do you want to create apps to help make your business more efficient? Then, this path is for you. It introduces you to Power Apps, helps you create and customize an app, and then manage and distribute it.
learningPaths.title: Create a canvas app in Power Apps

learningPaths.summary: Do you need to connect an app to access data? Then this learning path is for you. It will focus on how to connect to data sources. It also will show you how to use filtering, conditions, and other functions to shape your data and write data to your data source.
learningPaths.title: Work with data in a Power Apps canvas app

learningPaths.summary: This learning path introduces you to Power BI, and teaches you to use and build business intelligence reports.
learningPaths.title: Create and use analytics reports with Power BI

learningPaths.summary: The app user experience often defines the success of your app. This learning path will focus on how to provide the best app navigation, and build the best UI using themes, icons, images, personalization, different form factors, and controls.
learningPaths.title: Use the UI and controls in a canvas app in Power Apps

learningPaths.summary: Is the Power Platform new to your organization? Are you looking to better understand how you can improve your organization’s productivity, without compromising your security posture, while enabling governance? Take this learning path, to identify best practices for securing and governing Power Automate environments. We will share tools and templates that can be used to ensure you are productive as you secure and govern the Power Platform.
learningPaths.title: Use best practices to secure and govern Power Automate environments

learningPaths.summary: As a developer working with Finance and Operations apps, it's important to have a firm grasp of the main architecture components of the Dynamics 365 ecosystem and Finance and Operations apps. Knowledge of core developer concepts, including technical capabilities, source code, testing frameworks, and reporting tools, will support your further efforts in building development skills that you can apply to Finance and Operations apps.
learningPaths.title: Introduction to developing with Finance and Operations apps

learningPaths.summary: Do you need to create purchase documents like purchase orders and purchase invoices? This learning path shows you how to create purchase documents and address things such as discounts and item charges.
learningPaths.title: Purchase items and services in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

learningPaths.summary: Dynamics 365 Portals provide a great way to allow internal and external audiences to view and interact with data from Dynamics 365 and should be a consideration as a pillar in an organization's overall web strategy. This learning path introduces you to the Dynamics 365 Starter Portals that can be quickly provisioned to serve a variety of different audiences and workloads. We will also cover fundamentals of portal administration, maintenance, and troubleshooting..
learningPaths.title: Get started with Dynamics 365 Portals

learningPaths.summary: Are you interested in learning about business applications? Start with this learning path to see how Dynamics 365 apps are used. Learn about cloud concepts, Power Platform, and how to get started with Dynamics 365 apps.
learningPaths.title: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Fundamentals

learningPaths.summary: Get started with Power Apps Component Framework with an introductory module on the core concepts and components. This is followed by modules that show you how to build a component and work with advanced Power Apps Component Framework features.
learningPaths.title: Create components with Power Apps Component Framework

learningPaths.summary: Do you receive payments from customers and pay vendors? This module will help you track both in cash management and process those transactions as necessary in Business Central.
learningPaths.title: Process customer and vendor payments in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

learningPaths.summary: The process of working with customers, understanding the life cycle of the sales process, and setting up sales agreements are all important factors that impact a company's success.
learningPaths.title: Configure and manage sales, and customers in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management

learningPaths.summary: Learn how Finance and Operations apps support businesses to manage their global financial systems, operational business processes, and streamlined supply chains to empower people to make fast, informed decisions. As the first step in your career of working with Finance and Operations apps, you must familiarize yourself with its features and functionality, whatever your desired role.
learningPaths.title: Get started with Finance and Operations apps

learningPaths.summary: This learning path focuses on working with Knowledge Management Solutions in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service.
learningPaths.title: Work with Knowledge Management Solutions in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service

learningPaths.summary: Transportation management in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management helps you find the most efficient way to deliver goods to your customers. Transportation management calculates the least expensive and fastest way of delivering goods and lets you identify vendor and routing solutions for inbound and outbound orders.
learningPaths.title: Configure and work with transportation management in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management

learningPaths.summary: Are you just getting started with Business Central? This learning path will help prepare you for the types of data in Business Central and how to find information you need in the application.
learningPaths.title: Work like a pro with data in Business Central

learningPaths.summary: Integrate with Common Data Service using code by learning about Common Data Service API. Get an in-depth overview of options available with Common Data Service to integrate data and events to Azure.
learningPaths.title: Integrate with Power Platform and Common Data Service

learningPaths.summary: Developing and deploying true omnichannel solutions are critical to the success of any organization that provides customer service to its customers. By ensuring the unified and contextual experience regardless of the channel used, organizations can increase customer satisfaction, resolve issues faster, and increase revenue. With Dynamics 365’s Omnichannel for Customer Service solution, organizations deploy a true Omnichannel solution that exists inside the Dynamics 365 organization that they use every day.
learningPaths.title: Connect and engage with customers with Omnichannel for Dynamics 365 Customer Service

learningPaths.summary: Do you sell assembled items? This learning path provides the information you need to assembly management and items. It also provides steps to produce assembled items to stock or order.
learningPaths.title: Assemble items in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

learningPaths.summary: Process manufacturing is associated with formulas and manufacturing recipes, in contrast with discrete manufacturing, which uses discrete units, and bills of materials. Process manufacturing is used in manufacturing environments where production is completed in batch or semi-continuous processes.
learningPaths.title: Configure and use process manufacturing in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management

learningPaths.summary: Getting started with extending the Power Platform Common Data Service can be overwhelming. This learning path looks at the tools and resources needed for extending the Power Platform. We'll start with looking at the SDKs, the extensibility model, and event framework. This learning path also covers when to use plug-ins. Configuration of plug-ins as well as registering and deploying plug-ins.
learningPaths.title: Extending the Power Platform Common Data Service

learningPaths.summary: Set up and manage Dynamics 365 Marketing instances, keep Marketing up-to-date, configure advanced settings, and review domain authentication, email best practices, and data protection.
learningPaths.title: Set up Dynamics 365 Marketing and configure advanced settings

learningPaths.summary: Do you need to replenish inventory items in your business? This learning path will show you options you can use to efficiently replenish items in Business Central.
learningPaths.title: Replenish items in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

learningPaths.summary: Configure the Accounts receivable module in Dynamics 365 Finance to create customer invoices, post packing slips, and use free text invoices that are not related to sales orders. In this learning path, you will also learn how to do daily tasks in accounts receivable.
learningPaths.title: Work with accounts receivable in Dynamics 365 Finance

learningPaths.summary: If a company only produces simple products, production can be scheduled manually with the correct bill of materials (BOM) parts arriving on the production floor, at the correct time, and at the proper resource. As a functional consultant for manufacturing, you need to know how to configure Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management for discrete manufacturing, so your customer can perform and control the production lifecycle.
learningPaths.title: Configure and use discrete manufacturing in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management

learningPaths.summary: Cost accounting lets you collect data from various sources, such as the general ledger, sub-ledgers, budgets, and statistical information. You can then analyze, summarize, and evaluate cost data so that management can make the best possible decisions for price updates, budgets, cost control, and so on.
learningPaths.title: Get started with cost accounting for supply chains in Dynamics 365 Finance

learningPaths.summary: Generate leads, create opportunities, realize easy setup and integration, and streamline your sales processes with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales Professional.
learningPaths.title: Work with Dynamics 365 Sales Professional

learningPaths.summary: Do you want to use Business Central with other applications or make data available in the cloud? Then, complete this learning path. It also includes a module about changing how documents look in Business Central.
learningPaths.title: Set up Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central for reporting

learningPaths.summary: Field service companies often realize they need help as they discover that workflow inefficiencies are preventing growth and limiting revenue. Taking the right steps to configure Dynamics 365 Field Service will save you time during your implementation.
learningPaths.title: Implementing Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service

learningPaths.summary: This course is a bridge between the Dynamics 365 Fundamentals course and the Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations Apps core course.
learningPaths.title: Configure apps in Finance and Operations

learningPaths.summary: Dynamics 365 portals are designed for interaction with the internal and external audiences. There are additional requirements for content management and design, as well as the need to secure the content. This learning path describes how portal components work within context of Dynamics 365 to deliver the content and Common Data Service for Apps data to external and internal audiences. We will cover the topics of user authentication and how to secure access to different parts of the portal content based on the target audience and relationship to the content.
learningPaths.title: Work with portals in Dynamics 365

learningPaths.summary: As a functional consultant who works with Finance and Operations apps, you must understand how to set up an organization for your customer. This learning path shows you, amongst other tasks, how to set up legal entities, implement security settings, personalize the user interface for users, design, and build mobile apps, and implement common integrations.
learningPaths.title: Configure your organization in Finance and Operations apps

learningPaths.summary: Accounts payable are a liability due to a creditor when you order goods or services without paying in cash up front, which means that you buy goods on credit. Learn how to configure accounts payable in Dynamics 365 Finance, record vendor invoices, and distribute expenses, tax, and charges across accounts.
learningPaths.title: Work with accounts payable in Dynamics 365 Finance

learningPaths.summary: Do you want to learn how to build solutions that can leverage a standardized data structure and work with other solutions sharing the same data model? Do you want to extend the standard model to support custom solutions? This learning path will explain the concepts behind and benefits of Common Data Service. Creating an environment, entities, fields and options sets are also discussed.
learningPaths.title: Get started using Common Data Service

learningPaths.summary: Focus on evaluating analytics and key performance indicators of your marketing efforts to help understand impact and what tactics work best for your target audience. This learning path covers reviewing insights captured from contacts, leads, accounts, segments, and more. Entity-level and form-level calendars are covered as well as creating and customizing marketing calendars.
learningPaths.title: Analyze insights in Dynamics 365 Marketing

learningPaths.summary: Create client scripting, perform common actions with client script, and automate business process flow with client script is covered in this learning path. Learn about what client script can do, rules, and maintaining scripts. Discover when to use client script as well as when not to use client script.
learningPaths.title: Extending the Power Platform user experience Model Driven apps

learningPaths.summary: Are you using Trade in Business Central? This learning path discusses the setup requirements and how to start using Trade in Business Central.
learningPaths.title: Get started with Trade in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

learningPaths.summary: Do you need to use cost accounting in your company? This learning path can help get you started with cost accounting in Business Central. It explains cost accounting setup, how to create master data for cost accounting, how to transfer transactions, and allocate costs to a group of accounts.
learningPaths.title: Use cost accounting in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

learningPaths.summary: Learn how to use the Marketing application to guide your prospects and customers through a process of automated messaging, activity generation, and interactive decision points. You’ll learn how to create and manage marketing content such as marketing forms, pages, and emails. Additionally, you’ll learn how to tailor your messages to specific audiences through segmentation and build automated campaigns known as customer journeys.
learningPaths.title: Work with core features in Dynamics 365 Marketing

learningPaths.summary: So, you want to be a Power Platform developer! This learning path is the first step in learning about the platform, tools, and the ecosystem of the Power Platform.
learningPaths.title: Introduction to developing with the Power Platform

learningPaths.summary: Lifecycle Services (LCS) is a collaborative workspace that customers and their partners use to manage Finance and Operations apps projects from pre-sales to the implementation phase and finally to the production environment. It provides checklists and tools that help you manage the project, including pre-build methodologies to help with implementation and regularly updated services.
learningPaths.title: Use Lifecycle Services to design and plan an implementation of Finance and Operations apps

learningPaths.summary: Asset Management is an add-in for Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management, that is used to manage assets that are used in the daily operation of your company. Some examples of these types of assets are machinery, production equipment, and fork lifts.
learningPaths.title: Configure Asset Management for Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management

learningPaths.summary: Business leaders can make important decisions in their company if they have accurate insight into the underlying financial and operational data. A business user can also configure, and use the electronic reporting tool without a single line of code, to adopt new regulatory requirements and generate business documents in the required format to electronically exchange information with government bodies, banks, and other parties.
learningPaths.title: Configure and work with analytics and reporting in Finance and Operations apps

learningPaths.summary: Are you interested in learning about business applications? Perhaps you don’t know where to begin with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platform applications? Learn how the power of business applications can help transform your business.
learningPaths.title: Learn the business value of Microsoft Dynamics 365 and the Power Platform

learningPaths.summary: Schedule anything to the right resource for any job or task with ease. Universal Resource Scheduling (URS) is a Dynamics 365 for Customer Engagement solution that allows organizations from different industries with different scenarios.
learningPaths.title: Universal Resource Scheduling in Microsoft Dynamics 365 for Field Service

learningPaths.summary:
A Solution Architect is responsible for the successful design, implementation, deployment, and adoption of an overall solution. A Solution Architect ensures that the solution meets the customer’s needs now and in the future. While the Solution Architect may not “click the buttons” during a deployment, they are ultimately responsible for the solution and work closely with the deployment team.

This learning path covers the pre-sales and analysis phases of a project to include:

  • What it takes to become a Solution Architect.
  • Discovering customer needs.
  • Proposing a solution.
  • Working with requirements.
  • Performing fit-gap analysis.

Instructor-led training (ILT) is scheduled for March 2020 that provides more hands-on activities and both this path and ILT are needed for the exam.
learningPaths.title: Becoming a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform

learningPaths.summary: Do you need to set up and calculate VAT for your company? Take this learning path that contains information about setting up VAT, processing VAT, calculating and posting settlements, and making a VAT rate change.
learningPaths.title: Process VAT in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

learningPaths.summary: Dynamics 365 Finance empowers business users to control finances and manage funds with accurate information at any time for financial planning and forecasting, and stay up to date with analytics. Since finance is the heart of the business, and the General ledger module is the heart of financial management, this learning path shows you how to set up functionality in the General ledger module. It also covers how to complete closing procedures for a period or a year.
learningPaths.title: Configure and use the general ledger in Dynamics 365 Finance

learningPaths.summary: Unify customer data with prebuilt connectors, predict customer intent with rich segmentation, and maintain control of your customer data. This introductory learning path starts with creating a unified profile and then working with your customer data.
learningPaths.title: Unlock customer intent with Dynamics 365 Customer Insights

learningPaths.summary: Do you need to manage user access rights? In this learning path, you will learn how to manage permissions associated with environments and entities. You will also learn about different administrative portals and how to access each.
learningPaths.title: Manage permissions and administration for Common Data Service

learningPaths.summary: Do you want to find out how to reconcile bank accounts in Business Central? The bank reconciliation feature and reconciliation journals are discussed in this learning path.
learningPaths.title: Reconcile bank accounts in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

learningPaths.summary: Are you responsible for period and year-end closing processes? Complete this module, which discusses how to send reminders and finance charge memos to customers. It also discusses Intrastat processing and reporting, and closing a fiscal year.
learningPaths.title: Process financial periodic activities in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

learningPaths.summary: Do you want to use Business Central for financial management? Then, this learning path is for you. It discusses the setup of number series, audit trail codes, posting groups, dimensions and the chart of accounts.
learningPaths.title: Set up financial management in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

learningPaths.summary: Every organization, whether it is private or public, sets financial and operational goals by creating budgets. With the collaborative and process-driven nature of budget planning, you can make your budget process more efficient.
learningPaths.title: Configure and use budgeting in Dynamics 365 Finance

learningPaths.summary: Create, design, and administer Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement tenants and instances including planning for multi-instance deployments, managing authentication methods, managing updates, backup and restore instances, install and manage Microsoft Dynamics 365 clients for end-users, and authorizing access to different features for all users in the organization.
learningPaths.title: Implementing Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement Online

learningPaths.summary: Warehouse management in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management helps optimize and streamline warehouse processes according to your individual needs and provides the insight into your inventory and the tools to help increase customer satisfaction and reduce costs.
learningPaths.title: Configure and work with warehouse management in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management

learningPaths.summary: If you sell items or services to customers, this learning path can help you learn how to use Business Central to manage the sales process.
learningPaths.title: Sell items and services in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

learningPaths.summary: Do you work with multiple currencies? If you do, this path will help you understand the steps you need to complete to set up and use multiple currencies, process payments and invoices in different currencies, and adjust exchange rates when necessary.
learningPaths.title: Use multiple currencies in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

learningPaths.summary: Using warehouse management in manufacturing processes in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management helps optimize and streamline warehouse processes in your manufacturing environment, according to your company's needs.
learningPaths.title: Use warehouse management in manufacturing in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management

learningPaths.summary: You can use the Cash and bank management module in Dynamics 365 Finance to maintain an organization's bank accounts and the financial instruments that are associated with those bank accounts. All businesses must collect and pay taxes to various tax authorities. In this learning path you will learn how to configure and use these areas of Dynamics 365 Finance.
learningPaths.title: Configure and use cash and bank management, and sales tax in Dynamics 365 Finance

learningPaths.summary: In Microsoft Dynamics 365 Marketing, you can easily plan, execute, and follow up on your events. This learning path covers the key elements of the event module in the Marketing app including how to create events, manage sessions, speakers and logistics, enable event registration and manage the check-in process along with showing how to promote your event through other key Dynamics 365 features.
learningPaths.title: Manage events in Dynamics 365 Marketing

learningPaths.summary: The ability to easily surface and interact with Common Data Service data on an externally facing web site is the core benefit for implementing a Dynamics 365 portal. This learning path describes how to transform a content portal into a full web app that interacts with Common Data Service. We will explain how to secure data access based on the authenticated user role and relationship to the data. We will also cover the options available to customizers and developers to extend the portal functionality and integrate with Office 365 and Power platform components.
learningPaths.title: Extend Dynamics 365 portals

learningPaths.summary: You can set up and enter acquisition information for fixed assets, and then manage them by depreciating them and setting a capitalization threshold. The way in which fixed assets are handled must correspond with both international accounting standards and the accounting legislation in each country or region.
learningPaths.title: Configure and manage fixed assets in Dynamics 365 Finance

learningPaths.summary: Do you need to return items to vendors and accept returns from customers? This path will help you learn how to process returns.
learningPaths.title: Return items in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

learningPaths.summary: One of the key features of a Dynamics 365 model-driven app is its ability to be extended and customized without code. In this learning path, we will explore the Power Platform's configuration abilities and how to leverage them for a model-driven app.
learningPaths.title: Introduction to configuration in Dynamics 365 model-driven apps

learningPaths.summary: As a functional consultant, you must understand how to prepare your customer's data for migration, work with data management, and perform user acceptance testing to go live with Finance and Operations apps.
learningPaths.title: Migrate data and go live with Finance and Operations apps

learningPaths.summary: Are you interested in Business Central? If you are, this learning path provides a good introduction. It discusses how to set up a trial, provides some basic information about what's available, and shows some personalization options you can make to customize Business Central for your use.
learningPaths.title: Get started with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

learningPaths.summary: Do you need to create data relationships, business rules, calculations, and rollups in Common Data Service? These modules help you use Common Data Service to build powerful business solutions that will transform your operations, processes, and your entire organization. The learning path Get started with Common Data Service introduces you to Common Data Service and many of the key concepts which include environment, entities, fields, and options sets. This learning path continues and expands the exploration of Common Data Service with an overview how to form relationships between entities, how to build business rules to perform logic based upon your organization's needs, and how to add calculations and rollup fields.
learningPaths.title: Create relationships, business rules, calculations, and rollups in Common Data Service

learningPaths.summary: Extensions allow developers to make changes to the user experience in Finance and Operations apps by implementing modifications to the code that do not affect the base code. Among other benefits, extensions let developers update Finance and Operations apps to adhere to business processes and required changes.
learningPaths.title: Extend Finance and Operations apps

learningPaths.summary: This learning path focuses on working with entitlements and service level agreements in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service.
learningPaths.title: Work with entitlements and service level agreements in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service

learningPaths.summary: Configure and work with Dynamics 365 Sales Insights data to gain insights to your customers. This learning path covers configuration and working with Sales Insights.
learningPaths.title: Work with Dynamics 365 Sales insights

learningPaths.summary: Developing in Finance and Operations apps requires a basic understanding of the tasks required to build new elements and customize Finance and Operations apps. The tasks include understanding X++ code and Visual Studio, as well as being able to create and modify the basic elements of the system.
learningPaths.title: Build Finance and Operations apps

learningPaths.summary: Product information is the pillar of supply chain and retail applications across all industries. In the various modules of a business solution, product-specific information and configuration are required to manage the business processes that are related to products, product families, bills of materials, and product categories. Inventory reports show you in a variety of ways how much inventory you have and explain how to be more effective in your inventory investments. Master planning helps you streamline your planning based on predetermined factors, so you can efficiently plan what materials need to be purchased, transferred, or manufactured.
learningPaths.title: Configure and manage products and inventory in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management

learningPaths.summary: This learning path introduces you to connected Field Service and Azure IoT. Included in this learning path is identifying exceptions, register and manage devices, remotely monitor and service equipment, and using IoT central with connected Field Service.
learningPaths.title: Working with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT

learningPaths.summary: This learning path focuses on Case Management capabilities of Dynamics 365 Customer Service including options for creating cases, managing the case resolution process, working with case hierarchies and merging similar cases. Queues can be leveraged to maintain and manage Case workloads for customer service agents to include defining queues for different types of cases, managing queue items, picking and releasing queue items, and designing queue routing rules.
learningPaths.title: Work with cases in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service

learningPaths.summary: Generate leads, create opportunities, and utilize embedded intelligence with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales. This learning path covers the key elements of the Sales app.
learningPaths.title: Working with Dynamics 365 Sales

learningPaths.summary: Are you responsible for generating financial reports from Business Central? This learning path discusses creating budgets, and using account schedules, dimensions, and eXtensible business reporting language (XBRL) to generate the financial reports that are typically needed for most businesses.
learningPaths.title: Create financial reports in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

learningPaths.summary: Lean manufacturing is a journey of continuous improvement. The goal is to produce exactly what the customer wants, when the customer wants it, and to do it economically. You can use lean manufacturing in a unified (mixed-mode) manufacturing environment that combines various supply, production, and sourcing strategies. These strategies include production orders, batch orders for process industries, purchase orders, and transfer orders. The lean manufacturing architecture in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management consists of production flows, activities, and Kanban rules.
learningPaths.title: Configure and use lean manufacturing in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management

learningPaths.summary: Are you new to Business Central? If you are, this path will help you get started. It discusses how to create new companies, implement security, migrate data from other systems, and integrate Outlook with Business Central.
learningPaths.title: Deploy and configure Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

learningPaths.summary: Do you want to learn about the Business Central user interface? This learning path shows you the user interface, and also how you can personalize it. It also discusses alternate interfaces such as a smartphone.
learningPaths.title: Work with the Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central user interface

learningPaths.summary: The process of finding and working with vendors, purchasing products, and ensuring the quality of goods and services are all important factors that impact a company's reputation and success.
learningPaths.title: Configure and manage procurement and vendors in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management

learningPaths.summary: Asset Management is an add-in to Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management, that is used to manage assets that are used in the daily operation of your company. Some examples of these types of assets are machinery, production equipment, and fork lifts.
learningPaths.title: Work with Asset Management for Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management

learningPaths.summary: Do you need to create and post journal entries in Business Central? Then this path is for you. Setting up general journal templates, creating journal transactions including recurring transactions, and posting transactions are all discussed in the modules of this learning path.
learningPaths.title: Use journals in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

learningPaths.summary: Apply goal management to track your individual, parent, and child goals. Analyze the results of your goal management to make better business decisions.
learningPaths.title: Apply goal management to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement

learningPaths.summary: Integration and the ability to access your data in Finance and Operations apps are important capabilities. Developers who have learned to build and extend code in Finance and Operations apps can enhance their knowledge of development by learning about data integration and how connecting to data can have positive impacts on users.
learningPaths.title: Connect to Finance and Operations apps

learningPaths.summary: Do you need to process and post customer sales invoices? Do you need to enter vendor purchase invoices? This learning path addresses both, and also discusses how to process prepayments to customers and vendors. It also discusses using electronic documents in your business with Business Central.
learningPaths.title: Post sales and purchase invoices in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

learningPaths.summary: Capture, analyze, and act on customer and employee feedback. This learning path covers creating and sending surveys with Microsoft Forms Pro.
learningPaths.title: Create surveys with Microsoft Forms Pro

learningPaths.summary: This learning path introduces you to the basics of Voice of the Customer for Dynamics 365.
learningPaths.title: Voice of the Customer for Dynamics 365

learningPaths.summary: This learning path, which provides introductory level information on Teams, Power Platform, Security, and Compliance, will provide learners with knowledge on adjacent technologies that can come into play when positioning secure, integrated work management solutions.
learningPaths.title: Prepare to complete the Project Specialist Technical Achievement

learningPaths.summary: The Microsoft identity platform is an evolution of the Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) developer platform. It allows developers to build applications that sign in users, and access resources in both external applications such as Microsoft Office 365, the Azure portal, and thousands of other SaaS applications and internal resources, such as apps on your corporate network and intranet, along with any cloud apps developed by your own organization. Learn how to utilize Microsoft identity in your custom applications.
learningPaths.title: Implement Microsoft identity – Associate

learningPaths.summary:
Learn about the fundamentals of extending Office using Add-ins.

In this learning path, you'll understand:

  • Office Add-ins fundamentals
  • Office JavaScript APIs
  • Ways to customize Office Add-ins
  • Options for deploying, testing, and debugging Office Add-ins
learningPaths.title: Extend Office fundamentals

learningPaths.summary: Windows Virtual Desktop on Microsoft Azure is a desktop and app virtualization service that runs on the cloud. Windows Virtual Desktop works across devices – including Windows, Mac, iOS, and Android – with full-featured apps that you can use to access remote desktops and apps.
learningPaths.title: Deliver remote desktops and apps from Azure with Windows Virtual Desktop

learningPaths.summary: The Microsoft identity platform is an evolution of the Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) developer platform. It allows developers to build applications that sign in users, and access resources in both external applications such as Microsoft Office 365, the Azure portal, and thousands of other SaaS applications and internal resources, such as apps on your corporate network and intranet, along with any cloud apps developed by your own organization. Learn how to customize and extend Microsoft Teams.
learningPaths.title: Extend Microsoft Teams – Associate

learningPaths.summary: Manage shared content with Microsoft SharePoint introduces you to the features and capabilities of SharePoint, and how it works with Microsoft 365. You'll learn about the different types of SharePoint sites, including hub sites, as well as information protection, reporting, and monitoring. You'll also learn how to use SharePoint file and folder sharing to optimize collaboration, how to share files externally, and how to manage SharePoint sites in the SharePoint admin center.
learningPaths.title: Collaborate with SharePoint in Microsoft 365

learningPaths.summary: Microsoft Graph provides a unified programmability model that you can use to build apps that interact with the data of millions of users for organizations and consumers. Microsoft Graph APIs implements many of the OData protocol’s query parameters. Learn how to use Microsoft Graph in your custom applications.
learningPaths.title: Build apps with Microsoft Graph – Associate

learningPaths.summary: Protecting and securing your organization's information is more challenging than ever. The Protect enterprise information with Microsoft 365 learning path discusses how to protect your sensitive information from accidental oversharing or misuse, how to discover and classify data, how to protect it with sensitivity labels, and how to both monitor and analyze your sensitive information to protect against its loss.
learningPaths.title: Protect enterprise information with Microsoft 365

learningPaths.summary: Manage your enterprise deployment with modern tools from Microsoft 365. Empower your users and IT to benefit from the easy deployment and productivity enhancements from Windows 10, while still maintaining your standards for security and manageability.
learningPaths.title: Manage your enterprise deployment with Microsoft 365

learningPaths.summary: Microsoft SharePoint is a customizable platform that developers can extend with custom components. The SharePoint Framework is the recommended development model to extend the modern SharePoint experience. In this learning path, you'll learn how to customize and extend SharePoint using the SharePoint Framework using web parts and extensions.
learningPaths.title: Extend Microsoft SharePoint – Associate

learningPaths.summary: Learn how to move from a previous version of Microsoft Office to a newer version in your enterprise environment. Use Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager to roll out the upgrade at scale, saving you time and effort upgrading individual systems.
learningPaths.title: Upgrade Microsoft Office for IT at scale

learningPaths.summary: Manage team collaboration with Microsoft Teams introduces you to the features and capabilities of Microsoft Teams, the central hub for team collaboration in Microsoft 365. You’ll learn how you can use Teams to facilitate teamwork and communication within your organization, both on and off premises, on a wide range of devices—from desktops to tablets to phones—while taking advantage of all the rich functionality of Office 365 applications. You’ll gain an understanding of how Teams provides a comprehensive and flexible environment for collaboration across applications and devices.
learningPaths.title: Manage team collaboration with Microsoft Teams

learningPaths.summary: Microsoft threat protection in Microsoft 365 addresses today's security challenges by securing your organization's assets and proactively identifying and protecting against persistent threats to your network endpoints.
learningPaths.title: Defend against threats with Microsoft 365 and Microsoft threat protection

learningPaths.summary: In this introductory course, you'll learn the six critical elements to drive adoption of your Microsoft cloud services to deliver value to your company. This course is applicable to any size company and uses Office 365 and Microsoft Teams as the example service to create real world scenarios.
learningPaths.title: Use the Microsoft service adoption framework to drive adoption in your enterprise

learningPaths.summary: Microsoft 365 is an intelligent solution that includes Office 365, Windows 10, and Enterprise Mobility + Security, and empowers everyone to be creative and work together, securely. Learn how it supports your org's digital transformation.
learningPaths.title: Microsoft 365 Fundamentals

learningPaths.summary: Upgrade to Microsoft Teams explains how to upgrade from Skype for Business Online and Skype for Business on-premises to Microsoft Teams. You’ll learn how to plan your upgrade, how Skype for Business and Teams coexist and interoperate during the upgrade, and how to plan and configure a hybrid environment to move all users to the cloud when upgrading from Skype for Business on-premises.
learningPaths.title: Upgrade to Microsoft Teams

learningPaths.summary: Identity & access management is the foundation for a secure digital estate. The credentials that you issue to your users prove that they are who they claim to be and that they have permission to access your resources. Learn how to use Microsoft 365 to for authentication and authorization in your enterprise environment.
learningPaths.title: Protect identity and access with Microsoft 365

learningPaths.summary: We live in an always connected, technology-driven world. Efficient security management is the foundation to managing your assets – in the cloud, on-premises, or across a hybrid environment. You need to proactively manage and secure your organization’s identities, devices, end points (both apps and data), and IT infrastructure. Microsoft 365 helps you secure your infrastructure with a focus on visibility, control, and guidance, and helps you consolidate from a plethora of specialized functions and tools, leveraging the shared intelligence, to keep your security teams focused on the most critical insights for their workloads.
learningPaths.title: Manage security with Microsoft 365

learningPaths.summary: This learning path introduces you to what a modern workplace means for users and IT, and how Microsoft 365 can help you create it.
learningPaths.title: Modernize your workplace with Microsoft 365 and Surface for Business

learningPaths.summary: Microsoft 365 helps you create a secure, always-up-to-date environment by using Windows 10 devices that run Office 365 ProPlus apps and are managed by Microsoft Enterprise Mobility + Security. Learn the recommended steps to upgrade your organization to Windows 10 and Office 365 ProPlus, including how to leverage your existing tools and processes while adopting modern management technology and approaches along the way.
learningPaths.title: Microsoft 365 - Modernize your enterprise deployment with Windows 10 and Office 365 ProPlus
